str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Formerly, before. Neuter of proteros as adverb; previously.
Dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life. From anastrepho; behavior.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Old, ancient, not new or recent. From palai; antique, i.e. Not recent, worn out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To corrupt, spoil, destroy, ruin. Probably strengthened from phthio; properly, to shrivel or wither, i.e. To spoil or to ruin.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Deceit, deception, deceitfulness, delusion. From apatao; delusion.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
